newsitem.title: UK: THE PROTEUS COLUMN - Partner Re.
newsitem.headline: THE PROTEUS COLUMN - Partner Re.

text.p: Unlike many of the big insurance deals of the past 12 months, Partner Re's acquisition of SAFR from Swiss Re was well trailed. This was no hostile bid, but a planned deal between two companies with close links.

At the end of February, Partner Re said it expected to make an announcement on the proposed deal by March 31. Swiss Re already owns an 11 percent stake in the Bermuda-based reinsurer and had prepared the ground for the sale with SAFR's other big shareholders, French insurers AGF and Athena.
SAFR opens up new possibilities for the expanding Partner Re, one of the leading catastrophe reinsurers in Bermuda.

Swiss Re has been less forthcoming about its reasons for wanting to sell SAFR. However, it will retain an interest in SAFR through its holding in Partner Re, which could now be increased to a maximum 30 percent stake in the Bermudan reinsurer.

Another question raised by the deal is what will AGF do with its 2.5 billion French francs proceeds from the sale? With money in its pocket and pressure mounting to respond to the creation of the giant Axa-UAP group, we may not have to wait long for an answer.
